overview: 'Hide something for me. Look at the food, the whales. Look at the sea, the whalers. A blessing for them. Take that and hide it in your heart." -Iñupiaq elder Foster Simmonds Every spring for the last 2000 years, the Iñupiaq people have stood on the tuvaq, the edge of the shorefast ice, waiting for the annual migration of bowhead whales.
title: Anaiyyuun: Prayer for the Whale
